news.title: Presidential election expected to take place just over two weeks after Budget
news.summary: The election to choose the next president of Ireland is expected to take place on October 23rd.

news.title: ‘Starbucks was too big for somewhere so small’ – the Irish town that rejected US coffee giant
news.summary: "If you see a Starbucks, you know what you’re going to get,” according to coffee shop owner Peter O’Donovan, referring to the good and the bad of the ubiquitous chain that is celebrating 20 years in Ireland.

news.title: Israel bombs Gaza hospital killing at least 15 people, including journalists
news.summary: Israeli strikes on Nasser Hospital in Gaza on Monday killed at least 15 people, including three journalists, one of whom worked for Reuters, Palestinian health officials said.

news.title: Retiring from Dublin Airport after 46 years: 'There’s camaraderie you won’t find anywhere else... We’ve laughed together, cried together'
news.summary: When Denis Smyth walked into Dublin Airport as a recruit in 1979, he had no idea he’d still be there almost half a century later.

news.title: Eamonn Sweeney: Manchester United’s culture change is a myth – Ruben Amorim is going to run out of scapegoats
news.summary: Rumours of a ‘culture change’ at Manchester United have been greatly exaggerated.

news.title: Ciara Kelly: The backlash to U2’s statement illustrates that the woke are more interested in gatekeeping than truly supporting the people of Palestine
news.summary: I know I am slow to react to U2’s statement on the horrendous situation in Gaza. But I was thinking about it before I said anything – which is also bad it seems. Offering any kind of balance or nuance seems to be completely unacceptable. So be warned in advance: this article is going to be Outrageous!

news.title: My Money: ‘I signed a £100,000-record deal after Thin Lizzy broke up. It felt like I’d won the lottery!’
news.summary: Darren Wharton was just 18 when he joined Thin Lizzy as a keyboardist. He went on to co-write songs with frontman Phil Lynott.

news.title: Ask Allison: Since becoming a dad, I have no time for myself and my wife expects me to help out when I’m working from home
news.summary: I'm married with young kids and that brings its challenges. Babies came during Covid times and so I was home to help out a lot. My wife also had PND (postnatal depression), which we are lucky to be on the other side of.

news.title: Baby and several children among more than 100 tourists to fall ill with suspected salmonella poisoning at Spanish hotel
news.summary: More than 100 tourists including a 15-month-old baby and seven children have fallen ill with suspected salmonella poisoning at a hotel in south-eastern Spain.

news.title: Former Dublin GAA boss Jim Gavin linked with Fianna Fáil bid for presidency
news.summary: Jim Gavin is the latest name to be linked with becoming Fianna Fáil’s presidential election candidate.
